revised_title: Discovery of Golden-Colored Visual Pigment in the Conger Eel
tldr: Researchers discovered a golden-colored visual pigment in the retina of the conger eel, similar in shape to frog rhodopsin but with its maximum absorption shifted about 16 mμ towards the blue end of the spectrum. This pigment is found in deep-sea fish and silver freshwater eels as well. The study compares the absorption of light by photosensitive pigments in solution and in intact retinae, providing insights into the conger eel's vision and the visual systems of other deep-sea creatures.
